column2: A gift from Khaine, containing the secret of eternal youth and beauty. His brides may bathe in it to renew their vitality.
The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament, barded for further protection.
Those that bear an ever-burning Mark of Tzeentch have a natural capacity to manipulate magic and a strong prescience for seeing multiple fates.
Forest dwellers beware, lest you are watched, followed and taken, never to be seen again.
Covered in magical glyphs, this staff protects Wurrzag from the many magical machinations ranged against him.
An ornate helm of black steel that contains the tiniest fragments of Khaine's never-ending wrath.
The Empire is a nation of laws, and therefore also a nation of jails.
Animated by Dark Magic, a zombie dragon is an unholy parody of a once-noble beast now borne aloft by great tattered wings, its body covered with thick, withered hide.
The corrupted Dark Pegasi fly south from the Chaos Wastes to Naggaroth's Iron Mountains to make their nests.
The last relic of Gwynthraul's legendary quest; any who wear it are charged with his renowned strength and vigour.
Responsible for the grooming, wardrobe, and presentation of their charges, a valet is indispensable for the style-conscious noble.
I am the strongest - I am the one… and my wares are the finest you'll see around these parts, I'll wager!
Anath Raema's savage children can break enemy lines with tooth and claw. This one ensures their obedience in battle.
A flask that contains a spicy, salty brew blessed by Valaya herself.
Found in the hands of a long-dead guardian, this sword guides its user, making them a much better fighter.
Made from the skull of a geomancer - when filled with soil, the chalice can summon a deluge of blood-soaked mud.
The horses of Norsca live for battle, even choosing to graze on the bones of the fallen over grass.

A rotting pelt, shrouded in dark tendrils of malice that only the bravest or foolish should wear.

This small, blue cap is adorned with prayers to Neru, so she may have special care for its wearer's precious head.
A massive tower-shield usually taken into battle by Iron Wardens. Its bulk is worth the protection it provides.
This helm, inscribed with an invocation to the malign Desert-God, so that his savage ferocity may overtake its wearer.
This gigantic, reanimated hulk of flesh, timber and stone is one of the most fearsome things ever to lurch onto a battlefield.
The lone Bounty Hunter can go places that ungainly military units cannot.
Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.

Such is the supernatural fear instilled by the visage of the Bloody-handed God upon this standard that few dare to even look at it.

Forged by fallen Priests of Vaul and fuelled by the blood of sacrificial victims.

Those who don the Armour of Fortune seem to have the favour of Ranald, able to parry the lethal blow with a lucky deflection.
The best of all horse breeds found anywhere in the world, Elven steeds are noble, intelligent, graceful, and swift.
The Ranger’s Standard grants beings under its banner the agility and the wherewithal to scout ahead of the enemy.
Dark, feral beasts indigenous to Lustria, tempted from their tropical jungles to bear the Lizardmen to battle.
The servants of Chaos are more than the barbarous Northmen - throughout the mortal realms secret cults worship the true Gods, and so our plans advance.
Mounted on a giant shaggy wolf, this Goblin is a grizzled veteran, having run away from countless enemies in his time.

The Slave Master takes the thralls taken on the raids and prepares them for bloody sacrifice or, even worse, a grisly life of servitude.

War Standard o' the Corpse Surgeons

Secretly nurtured by Malekith, Black Dragons are enchanted with Dark Magic that corrupts and enhances.
